{"id":1122196814,"question_id":3229,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"5 months, 4 weeks","timestamp":1702865617,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"15 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1122196814/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Cost to Make Array Equalindromic","memory":"55.6 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public long minimumCost(int[] nums) {\n\n        Arrays.sort(nums);\n\n        int len = nums.length;\n\n        int mid = nums[len/2];\n\n        int p1 = nextPal(mid);\n        int p2 = prevPal(mid);\n\n        long sum1 = getSum(nums, p1);\n        long sum2 = getSum(nums, p2);\n        return Math.min(sum1, sum2);\n    }\n\n    private long getSum(int[] nums, int p){\n        long res = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<nums.length; i++){\n            res+= Math.abs(nums[i]-p);\n        }\n\n        return res;\n    }\n\n\n    private int nextPal(int n){\n        while(!isPal(n)){\n            n++;\n        }\n        return n;\n    }\n\n    private int prevPal(int n){\n        while(!isPal(n)){\n            n--;\n        }\n        return n;\n    }\n\n    private boolean isPal(int n){\n        int tmp = n;\n        int rev = 0;\n        while(tmp>0){\n            rev = rev*10 + tmp%10;\n            tmp/=10;\n        }\n\n        return rev==n;\n    }\n        \n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-cost-to-make-array-equalindromic","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
